learningContent.title: The DITA learning and training content specialization
learningContent.shortdesc: This topic introduces the technical specifications for DITA learning and training content

lcIntro.p: The DITA for learning technical specifications provide a starting point for those professionals looking to take advantage of DITA and apply it to learning. The specifications were drawn up by a sub-committee of the OASIS DITA Technical Committee, composed of DITA experts and learning professionals, all with a keen interest in creating a specialization that addresses the unique needs of the learning community. These specifications are not meant to be the end point, but rather the launching pad and the foundation from which DITA extends itself into the world of learning and training.

concept.title: Introducing the DITA for Learning Spec

dlentry.dd: The learning plan allows a learning design team to provide descriptive data about the learning need being addressed and the mechanics of how it will be addressed. It provides a way for learning professionals to chart a clear path for a learning endeavor prior to authoring any actual content. The data provided in this topic type will provide entire learning teams, including design and development personnel the path and tools that will most likely be required to fulfill the obligations of the learning need.

The learning overview identifies the learning objectives, includes other information helpful to the learner, such as prerequisites, duration, intended audience, and can include information and strategies that seek to gain attention and stimulate recall of prior learning. A learning overview provides a bird's eye view of the content and let a potential learner know what to expect as they proceed through the rest of the content.

The learning summary recaps and provides context for the learning objectives, provides guidance to reinforce learning and long-term memory, and may pose questions to enhance encoding and verification of the learning content. The learning summary brings closure for the learner on the content and summarizes the key learning points covered in the main body of the content.

The learning content provides the learning content itself, and enables direct use of content from DITA task, concept, and reference topics, as well as additional content of any topic type that supports the specific objectives declared in the learning overview topic type. It is here that a learner can expect to find the actual "content" that supports the objectives identified by the overview.
The learning assessment presents instruments that measure progress, encourage retrieval, and stimulate reinforcement of the learning content.

section.title: The Interactions Domain
section.p: Although Interactions were built to support the notion of assessment they have been created as a DITA domain, and made available in the lcInteractions element in learningAssessmentbody.

Because the interactions are defined as a DITA domain, however, they can be made available for use in other topic types, if that is desirable. For example, you could make lcInteractions available for use in learning activities within the body of a learning content topic.

section.title: The learning map domain
section.p: The learning map domain defines the following set of specialized topicref elements:learningGroupA container to introduce and group learning objects into higher-level organizations, such as course-level, module-level, or lesson-level. A learningGroup can contain other learningGroup elements, allowing you to organize learning content at course, module, or other higher-levels of hierarchy.learningObjectA container to introduce and group the topic references for a learning object. learningPlanRefA topic reference to a learning plan topic.learningOverviewRefA topic reference to a learning overview topic, which introduces the learning object.learningContentRefOne or more topic references to a learning content topic, or a topic, task, concept, reference or other specialized topic.learningSummaryRefA topic reference to a learning summary topic.learningPreAssessmentRefA topic reference to a learning assessment topic that is used as a pre-assessment.learningPostAssessmentRefA topic reference to a learning assessment topic that is used as a post-assessment.
A DITA learning object in a map domain looks like the following:
section.pre: <learningObject collection-type="sequence" href="../ImportModules/top_Overview.dita" type="learningOverview"> <learningPlanRef href="../ImportModules/learningPlan_topic.dita" type="learningPlan"/> <learningOverviewRef href="../ImportModules/lo_Overview.dita" type="learningOverview"/> <learningContentRef href="../ImportModules/lo_Content.dita" type="learningContent"/> <learningPostAssessmentRef href="../ImportModules/lo_Assess.dita" type="learningAssessment/"> <learningSummaryRef href="../ImportModules/lo_Summary.dita" type="learningSummary"/> <learningObject>

section.title: Learning metadata
section.p: In addition to standard DITA metadata, learning-specific metadata is also available for use with learning topics and learning maps, through a DITA domain specialization. This learning metadata follows the IEEE LOM standard for learning objects metadata.

ul.li: lcLom, makes the lom elements available in the learning topics
